question: What is Address Binding?
options: ['a) going to an address in memory', 'b) locating an address with the help of another address', 'c) binding two addresses together to form a new address in a different memory space', 'd) a mapping from one address space to another']
option1: a) going to an address in memory
option2: b) locating an address with the help of another address
option3: c) binding two addresses together to form a new address in a different memory space
option4: d) a mapping from one address space to another

question: Binding of instructions and data to memory addresses can be done at ____________
options: ['a) Compile time', 'b) Load time', 'c) Execution time', 'd) All of the mentioned']

question: If the process can be moved during its execution from one memory segment to another, then binding must be ____________
options: ['a) delayed until run time', 'b) preponed to compile time', 'c) preponed to load time', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: What is Dynamic loading?
options: ['a) loading multiple routines dynamically', 'b) loading a routine only when it is called', 'c) loading multiple routines randomly', 'd) none of the mentioned']
option2: b) loading a routine only when it is called

question: What is the advantage of dynamic loading?
options: ['a) A used routine is used multiple times', 'b) An unused routine is never loaded', 'c) CPU utilization increases', 'd) All of the mentioned']
option1: a) A used routine is used multiple times
option2: b) An unused routine is never loaded

question: The idea of overlays is to ____________
options: ['a) data that are needed at any given time', 'b) enable a process to be larger than the amount of memory allocated to it', 'c) keep in memory only those instructions', 'd) all of the mentioned']
option1: a) data that are needed at any given time
option2: b) enable a process to be larger than the amount of memory allocated to it
option3: c) keep in memory only those instructions

question: The ___________ must design and program the overlay structure
options: ['a) programmer', 'b) system architect', 'c) system designer', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: The ___________ swaps processes in and out of the memory
options: ['a) Memory manager', 'b) CPU', 'c) CPU manager', 'd) User']

question: If a higher priority process arrives and wants service, the memory manager can swap out the lower priority process to execute the higher priority process
options: ['a) priority swapping', 'b) pull out, push in', 'c) roll out, roll in', 'd) none of the mentioned']

question: If binding is done at assembly or load time, then the process _____ be moved to different locations after being swapped out and in again
In a system that does not support swapping ____________
options: ['a) the compiler normally binds symbolic addresses (variables) to relocatable addresses', 'b) the compiler normally binds symbolic addresses to physical addresses', 'c) the loader binds relocatable addresses to physical addresses', 'd) binding of symbolic addresses to physical addresses normally takes place during execution']
option1: a) the compiler normally binds symbolic addresses (variables) to relocatable addresses
option2: b) the compiler normally binds symbolic addresses to physical addresses
option3: c) the loader binds relocatable addresses to physical addresses
option4: d) binding of symbolic addresses to physical addresses normally takes place during execution

question: Which of the following is TRUE?
options: ['a) Overlays are used to increase the size of physical memory', 'b) Overlays are used to increase the logical address space', 'c) When overlays are used, the size of a process is not limited to the size of the physical memory', 'd) Overlays are used whenever the physical address space is smaller than the logical address space']
option1: a) Overlays are used to increase the size of physical memory
option2: b) Overlays are used to increase the logical address space
option3: c) When overlays are used, the size of a process is not limited to the size of the physical memory
option4: d) Overlays are used whenever the physical address space is smaller than the logical address space
